u.a: ɡʊın tə weıv dædi aʊt ə wındəu
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
first recorded instance of use of "you"
first syllable deleted in "another"; second element of cluster omitted in "pram";
laık ə pʊt dəʊz ʃu:z tə sli:p

g.ga: I'm doing a lot of shopping

u.a: voiceless palato-alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless labio-dental fricative;
initial "sl" cluster replaced by labio-dental fricative;
dæt dɒli ɡu tə bɛd ın dɛə
second element of cluster omitted; voiced palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiced dental fricative;
ıts ə lɒŋ weı tə keımbıð [*]
second element of cluster omitted; voiced palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiced dental fricative;
voiced palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiced dental fricative;
voiceless glottal fricative replaced by voiceless labio-dental fricative; bilabial nasal replaced by alveolar nasal;

g.ga: I want to have it on the table

u.a: maı [*] laık hæv ə dıŋk [*] ə mıʊk
my = I'd; second element of cluster omitted in "drink";
mɑ [*] laık ə kʌp ə ti tu
final voiceless alveolar plosive and initial voiceless palato-alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
in reply to question: Do you want a cup of tea ?
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
voiceless palato-alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
dædi ɡɒt ə bæn [*] nu: pɛn
voiceless palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
voiceless labio-dental fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
maı [*] nɒt drɔrın ɒn ə peıpə tədeı
we must not draw on Daddy's book
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
maı [*] dəʊn laık hæv ıt ɒn
first syllable omitted; first element of cluster omitted;
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
laık ə weıv dædi aʊt ə wındəʊ
voiced alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
mɑ [*] laık ə pʊt dæt ɒn ə teıbʊ
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless alveolar plosive;
dædi lɛn dæt wʌn ın ə mınıt
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental fricative;
mɑ [*] gəʊ tə wə:k wıð maı ɵu:tkeıs [*]
me = I'm ; voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless dental ficative;

CHAT.comment: 1.At this stage , fall-rise is usual tune for questions , accompanied by eyebrow raising and head nodding. At this stage , Jane uses "my" and "ma" in subject position for "I". "mineÕs" is also used , usually to replace "I am" , as in "MineÕs eating a bit more".
